alert.note: Alert for East Puget Sound Lowlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 17 at 2:22PM PST until January 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of up to a quarter of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...East Puget Sound Lowlands from Snohomish County to Pierce County, including Arlington, Gold Bar, Duvall, Snoqualmie, Buckley, and Eatonville. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers will linger into this evening before tapering off tonight. Additional snow and freezing rain is expected Thursday, especially for areas near the Cascade gaps, such as North Bend and Gold Bar.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
